title: Hannibal
Author: Thomas Harris
Genres: Novel, Suspense, Thriller, Horror fiction, Gothic fiction, Fantasy Fiction, Psychological Fiction
Description: Hannibal is a novel by American author Thomas Harris, published in 1999. It is the third in his series featuring Dr. Hannibal Lecter and the second to feature FBI Special Agent Clarice Starling.

title: Chocolat
Author: Joanne Harris
Genres: Novel, Magical Realism, Fantasy Fiction, Psychological Fiction
Description: Chocolat is a 1999 novel by Joanne Harris. It tells the story of Vianne Rocher, a young single mother, who arrives in the French village of Lansquenet-sous-Tannes at the beginning of Lent with her six-year-old daughter, Anouk.

title: Wholeness and the Implicate Order
Author: David Bohm
Description: Wholeness and the Implicate Order is a book by theoretical physicist David Bohm. It was originally published in 1980 by Routledge, Great Britain.

title: The Amber Spyglass
Author: Philip Pullman
Description: The Amber Spyglass is the third novel in the His Dark Materials trilogy, written by English author Philip Pullman. Published in 2000, it won the 2001 Whitbread Book of the Year award, the first children's novel to do so.

title: Feed
Author: Matthew Tobin Anderson
Genres: Novel, Young adult fiction, Science Fiction, Dystopian Fiction
Description: Feed is a young adult dystopian novel of the cyberpunk subgenre written by M. T. Anderson. The novel focuses on issues such as corporate power, consumerism, information technology, data mining, and environmental decay, with a sometimes sardonic, sometimes somber tone.

title: The Selfish Gene
Author: Richard Dawkins
Description: The Selfish Gene is a 1976 book on evolution by the biologist Richard Dawkins, in which the author builds upon the principal theory of George C. Williams's Adaptation and Natural Selection.

title: The Audacity of Hope: Thoughts on Reclaiming the American Dream
Author: Barack Obama
Description: The Audacity of Hope: Thoughts on Reclaiming the American Dream is the second book written by then-Senator Barack Obama. It became number one on both the New York Times and Amazon.com bestsellers lists in the fall of 2006, after Obama had been endorsed by Oprah Winfrey.

title: The Little Stranger
Author: Sarah Waters
Description: The Little Stranger is a 2009 gothic novel written by Sarah Waters. It is a ghost story set in a dilapidated mansion in Warwickshire, England in the 1940s.

title: The Testaments
Author: Margaret Atwood
Description: The Testaments is a 2019 novel by Margaret Atwood. It is a sequel to The Handmaid's Tale. The novel is set 15 years after the events of The Handmaid's Tale. It is narrated by Aunt Lydia, a character from the previous novel; Agnes, a young woman living in Gilead; and Daisy, a young woman living in Canada.
